file_content.text: The planet is stable?
Aftershocks continue, but the core has reached equilibrium. We are finalizing safe techniques to mine the isotope-5.
Sergeant Bedareux is seeing to security on the ground. He's done admirably in... Lord Cytharat's stead.
Sergeant Bedareux is seeing to security on the ground, and Lord Cytharat's almost fully recovered. He'll be back from Dromund Kaas shortly.
I did not expect this outcome, Wrath--but it serves well. Your team was satisfactory?
Enough.
You have done... far more than others on the council would have. Your team was satisfactory?
Commander. Was your support team satisfactory?
You have done your part, hunter. You found the support team satisfactory?
You did well on Makeb. Your team was satisfactory?
My people did their part. What about your fleet? Is it ready to surround the system?
Let's focus on what's next.
You selected my team poorly. Not one of them should have been part of this mission.
Replace them for incompetence.
Many died doing their duty.
They will be justly rewarded. Begone, all of you.
For the next month, each gram of isotope-5 we procure will be needed for our defenses. The next phase of the war begins.
As soon as the Republic and Hutts complete their evacuation.
Lord Cytharat and Katha Niar sacrificed themselves to complete the mission. They weren't the only ones; they should be remembered.
Katha Niar sacrificed herself for the mission. So did others; they should be remembered.
Let their names be etched in the walls of Kaas City. It will be their monument, or their pyre.
Thank you, my lord.
Speak.
Darth Imperius. This is Darth Marr.
Darth Occlus. This is Darth Marr.
Darth Nox. This is Darth Marr.
It is time the Dark Council lived up to its responsibilities. I require your resources in the name of war.
Marr. Last time we met was on Korriban over Thanaton's body.
It's been a while....
You are not my better, Marr. You and I both serve on the council.
Don't attempt to command me.
If you desire my resources, I expect to know why.
What's going on?
What is it you seek, exactly?
If we did not, I would not be speaking to you myself.
There is a planet on the edge of Hutt Space known as Makeb. It is the key to our survival.
Put aside your power plays and your search for the Dread Masters. Come to the Makeb system, and I will tell you of the coming doom.
Await my arrival. I'll proceed to Makeb immediately.
Very well.
Of all the Sith you could have contacted... why one you've never worked with?
Why choose me?
You speak as if the Empire is about to fall. Is this the valor of the Dark Council?
You sound afraid.
The blood of Malgus the Betrayer is fresh on your cheeks, but doom approaches swiftly. Come to the Makeb system, and tell no one.
It is the future before us. If you do not come to Makeb, I will find another.
I did not think I would live to see Thanaton overthrown. Strange, that I must turn to his successor.
Put aside your power plays and your fleets. Come to the Makeb system, swift and silent, and I will tell you of the coming doom.
Because Darth Thanaton had power and subtlety. I need both, and he is dead.
Come to Makeb, or I will find another.
Good.
You speak to the Emperor's Wrath.
Wrath. This is Darth Marr, of the Dark Council.
Tell me what you seek, Lord Marr. Why is our survival imperiled?
What's going on?
The Hand does not control my every action. If you have a challenge to offer, do so.
I'm free to seek new enemies.
Do not seek to goad me, Marr. I answer only to the Emperor himself.
Watch your tone.
As does the council. But our authority requires an Empire to have meaning.
The course of the war is changing. The Republic has tasted blood, and there is much you do not know.
The planet Makeb, on the edge of Hutt Space, is the key to victory or destruction. Come in secret, and we may discuss the coming doom.
The course of the war is changing. The betrayal of Darth Malgus did grievous harm, and there is much you do not know.
The course of the war is changing. The Dread Masters are only a part of what threatens us.
Is that desperation in your voice? Or resignation to your own weakness?
You sound afraid. Pathetic.
Very well--we shall rendezvous at Makeb. End communication.
Await my arrival.
You speak as if we are being watched.
Why so much secrecy?
Sooner or later, we are all found wanting. But today will not be our day.
There are risks enough in this endeavor. I will not tolerate another.
Come to Makeb. We shall rendezvous there.
This is an Intelligence frequency. Who's calling?
The Mandalorian. Good.
The bounty hunter. Good.
Darth Tormen spoke well of you before his death. I am Darth Marr, of the Dark Council; I would retain your services.
Darth Tormen credits you with the execution of the Supreme Chancellor. I am Darth Marr, of the Dark Council; I would retain your services.
I got used to dealing with Tormen. Why isn't he placing this call?
What happened to Tormen?
Do you have a problem with bounty hunters? Or me in particular?
You don't like me, do you?
Even without Tormen, I'm keeping busy. Why would I need another client?
I'm in high demand these days.
Darth Marr. Make me an offer.
I'll hear you out.
Your accomplishments are not without merit, but you are an outsider. If there were another, I would choose him.
Your pursuit of the Dread Masters can wait. A more pressing situation has arisen.
Wipe the blood of Malgus the Betrayer from your hands. A more pressing situation has arisen.
Put aside your contracts hunting smugglers and thieves. A more pressing situation has arisen.
We will rendezvous in the Makeb system, on the edge of Hutt Space. No one must know; take any precautions required for secrecy.
I'll have to go off comms and mask my engine trail. It'll take credits.
Secrecy costs extra.
You said Hutt Space? I've made enough enemies in the Cartel for one lifetime.
Hutts are bad for business.
All right. The Makeb system. But no promises, Marr.
I'll agree to a meeting.
He represents his own ambitions. I represent the needs of the Empire.
I will make sure you do not need Cartel business again.
You will be compensated. But do not delay.
I expect none.
I am Darth Marr, of the Dark Council.
I am Darth Marr, of the Dark Council. You are the agent who erased all records of her existence.
You are the former Cipher Nine? I am Darth Marr, of the Dark Council.
You have served the Sith loyally time and again, while your superiors offered failure and betrayal.
It is time your deeds were recognized. Imperial Intelligence is dead; you will be granted new responsibilities.
I'm honored to have earned your attention. How may I serve?
Thank you, my lord.
I am the Hand of Jadus. Do you speak with his authority?
I only answer to Darth Jadus.
I was promised a position of authority. Instead, I've been playing galactic troubleshooter.
You certainly kept me waiting.
Tell me what the Dark Council needs. I'll see what I can do.
Give me the assignment.
Darth Jadus remains in seclusion. Judge our needs as you like, but I think he will not return to object soon.
Before his removal from power, the former Minister of Intelligence ordered surveillance of the planet Makeb, on the edge of Hutt Space.
That surveillance has finally borne fruit. The course of the war is changing, and Makeb's secrets may be our key to survival.
"Our key to survival"? Not victory? Is the war going that well?
You sound pessimistic.
Even from beyond the grave, Imperial Intelligence is all that keeps the Empire together.
Intelligence saved you again.
Forward me the planet dossier. What's my part in these "secrets"?
I'll need details.
I am aware of your efforts against the Dread Masters. Other priorities have now arisen.
The death of Malgus the Betrayer was necessary. But now other priorities have arisen.
You desire the chance to do more? Very well.
This is not the time for that discussion.
We will rendezvous in the Makeb system. I will brief you personally, and you will lead our operations team there.
I am Darth Marr, of the Dark Council. You are the agent who erased all records of his existence.
I expended many resources to find you. Now we talk.
Speak your piece, Lord Marr.
What do you want?
I'm not exactly skulking in the shadows. If you wanted to talk, you had other opportunities.
I haven't been hiding.
It was not necessary until now.
I cut my ties with the Sith after you dissolved Imperial Intelligence. We have no business with each other.
I don't serve you anymore.
You have been pursuing the Dread Masters. You have not forgotten the interests of the Empire.
You bled the usurper Darth Malgus. You have not forgotten the interests of the Empire.
We share common enemies. Independent or not, you have not forgotten the interests of the Empire.
In another lifetime, I would seek your execution. Today, I propose an alliance for the sake of all Imperial worlds.
You'll forgive me if I'm cautious. What exactly do you propose?
What sort of alliance?
I have no intention of answering to the Dark Council--but neither of us wants the Empire destroyed. Tell me what's going on.
I'm glad you see reason.
If you expect me to start taking orders from the Dark Council, you'll have to do better than pleading. I'm not interested.
You can't be serious.
Then perhaps you will be interested in this.
Enough.
Consider this a first step toward a position of greater authority.
I'll set course for the Makeb system immediately.
I'm on my way.
You know the position I've earned. All I need is a staff and the title.
I want to be chief spymaster.
The time is coming. For now, I am transmitting military security codes; you have the rank of Special Projects Commander.
You're in no position to withhold anything. You need an expert on covert operations, and I'm the only one left.
You need me, not vice versa.
You've made your point.
One last thing: I am transmitting military security codes; you now have the rank of Special Projects Commander.
Use it as you see fit. Do not disappoint me.
An exchange of resources and information.
I require a leader for our operations on Makeb; one to whom I can entrust the security and secrecy of the mission.
I have no other options. Rendezvous in the Makeb system, and perhaps we can save the Empire from total destruction.
If I do this, Makeb is mine. I allocate resources, and my orders will not be countermanded.
My operation, my rules.
Turning to a non-Sith, someone you can't even command... how does it feel, Marr? What's it like to need help from a lesser being?
You must be truly desperate.
You overestimate your importance to my ego. I will do what is required to win victory.
I am transmitting military security codes to grant you the authority of Special Projects Commander.
Use it or not, but I will not have you slicing my data, and it will facilitate my people's cooperation. They are not trained to obey ghosts.
Agreed.
You have proven your loyalty, despite errors in judgment. Now you are all that remains of Imperial Intelligence, and we require your services.
Where are Keeper and the Minister of Intelligence? What about all the others?
What about my co-workers?
You dismantle my organization, and now you expect me to report for duty?
You've got a lot of nerve.
What became of Intelligence is unfortunate. But the Empire endures, and we all must serve.
Consider this a step toward redemption for yourself and your organization.
When this is over--if this operation is successful--you give me the means to restore Imperial Intelligence. It's the only way forward.
If I succeed, we rebuild.
It is not my decision alone. But things must change, and we shall see.
Your comrades remain dispersed. Your expertise is what is required.
I offer you challenge, and I offer you credits. Neither will be matched elsewhere.
Once, you defeated your traitorous master before us. Now you serve a silent Emperor and his cryptic Hand.
If you are content to stand unchallenged, then so be it. But I would test your strength for the Empire's survival.
The Hutt Cartel is weak and scattered, and the Jedi will turn back to us. At last, they are prepared to shed blood.
Last time we spoke, you had lost three star systems. What's happening in the galaxy?
Give me a war status update.
You had something special planned for the isotope--not just Imperial defenses across the board.
Why do you need the isotope-5?
We spent too long on Makeb. It's about time we fought the Republic again.
The Hutts were a distraction.
The chance is coming.
Fellow citizens of the Republic. The Hutt crisis is over, and we have again proven that compassion is not a weakness, but our strength.
Yet that is not why I stand before you. Instead, I can finally confirm what many have suspected for months:
The Sith Emperor is dead.
A Jedi strike team confronted the Emperor during a recent attack on Dromund Kaas.
Now a joint SIS and Jedi committee has concluded that the galaxy's greatest villain is gone forever.
This does not change the fight ahead. The Dark Council remains the true political power in the Empire.
But it sends a message to the Sith and their followers: We are coming for you.
They speak truth: The Emperor is gone, dying if not dead, no matter what our propagandists say. He will not be mourned.
Observe.
You do not understand. We require a defense against this:
You almost sound like you expected this.
You're awfully calm.
You say the Emperor is gone. What happened to him?
Tell me how this transpired.
I have heard the words of the Emperor's Hand. Our master is defeated in body, but not in spirit. Beware of defiance.
No--the Emperor is immortal.
Your boss is dead, Marr. Sounds like the Dark Council won't be far behind.
Guess you're in trouble.
The Empire exists to war against chaos. We pit armies against life, and death is our solace. The Emperor forgot this.
Now is our chance to reforge in the flames of battle--to reshape the Empire into an image of unity and strength.
You're making a grab for power. What makes you think I'll support you?
You want to rule yourself.
If he is not dead, then he is in no condition to rule--at least for the moment.
The Emperor's Hand claims that he lives still. But there will be many who seek to profit from the Emperor's absence.
There will be great chaos.
Too many Sith--my old master among them--have vied for power against the interests of the Empire. Too many Moffs have tolerated incompetence.
The Empire must be unified.
Let another claim the throne. My place is on the battlefield.
The Jedi struck him down; he is not mortal as we are, but he no longer speaks to the council.
We will speak when the enemy strikes again. Together, we will choose the destiny of the Empire and retake the galaxy.
The Emperor has ruled for a millennium. Without him, we are nothing.
The Empire is doomed.
Without the Emperor, many on the Dark Council will see the chance to fill the void.
This is an opportunity.
The Emperor was the only thing holding us together. If people believe he's gone, an aggressive Republic could push us back to the homeworlds.
This changes the war.
I do not ask for your allegiance, but the Wrath and the Dark Council must work together if anything is to survive.
In the coming months, we must all stand against the Republic offensive and those who would weaken us from within. It is the only way.
The Emperor will return. If we are to reforge and strengthen the Empire, it will be in his name, and to his purpose.
We serve the Emperor first.
Too many. A struggle now will ensure our demise.
Life is our battlefield. Death is our solace. The Emperor sought to escape that truth, and failed.
In the coming months, we will stand against the Republic offensive and those who would weaken us from within--and emerge stronger.
Very well, Wrath. Let us hope that is enough.
The Empire must change. And if we must stand on the precipice of death to do so, then so be it.
We stand as one.
I do not ask for your allegiance. But in the coming months, we must lead our people together and crush our enemies--inside and outside the Empire.
The Empire must be rebuilt before we can return to greatness. Until circumstances change, we have an alliance.
We're partners, for now.
So be it.
The Empire must be rebuilt. But your vision, Darth Marr, may not be mine.
What if our goals clash?
My "vision" is of an Empire ready to fight across the battlefield of life. That is all I require.
You chose to part ways with the Sith, but in the coming months, our security will be threatened and I have no taste for secrecy. We have much yet to do.
I'll work with you, Marr, for the same reasons I came to Makeb. You know how to contact me.
We stay allies... for now.
Yes, Commander.
Your vision for the Empire may be different from mine. We may not be allies forever.
What if our goals clash?
We need not trust each other to do what is required.
Your skills are needed, agent. In the coming months, our security will be threatened, and I have no taste for secrecy. But we must survive, and emerge stronger.
I've served the Empire from the beginning. I've made sacrifices. I will continue to do so.
I'll do what's necessary.
Then I was wise to call you "Commander."
You're asking me to safeguard the security of an Empire without the resources of an agency.
Intelligence is still gone.
You are a Special Projects Commander, and you have my authority to requisition what you need. More than that will have to wait.
You led our team on Makeb to victory. Stand with the Empire in the coming months and counsel our generals. You will see us rise to glory once again.
You're hiring me to save the Empire. Been a while since your team was the underdog.
Big job, big risk... I'm in.
But I can lease you my experience and my blaster, if you can pay the price.
You want me as more than a troubleshooter. You want an advisor. Is that why you sent me here?
Was all this a job interview?
I sent you to Makeb because I had no other recourse. The rest is the reward of success.
Today, you bought us time. Isotope-5 will pay for the Empire's new foundation, and the Republic knows nothing of our actions.
